alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 7:39AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Major severity for the following rivers in New Mexico... LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is possible in this location. * WHERE...LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood waters will begin to innudate agricultural lands near the gage. Minor flooding along portions of Los Pinos Access Road will be possible. Low water crossings will become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM MDT Monday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM MDT Monday was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.3 feet on 05/09/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
